content: The Act may be cited as the "Access to High Standards Act." Congress finds that many students lack academic preparation in secondary school, leading to limited job opportunities, high college dropout rates, and the need for remediation in college. There is a consensus on the importance of raising academic standards and modeling them after advanced placement programs, which are endorsed by many education leaders and half of all States. Advanced placement programs offer 30 college-level courses, benefiting almost 60 percent of students. Advanced placement programs offer 30 college-level courses, serving almost 60 percent of secondary schools and over 1,000,000 students. SEC. 4. ON-LINE ADVANCED PLACEMENT COURSES. The Secretary will award grants to local educational agencies to provide students with online advanced placement courses. Agencies receiving grants can contract with organizations for course provision. Priority is given to agencies serving low-income or rural students without access to such courses. Grant funds can be used for necessary support services. Grant funds provided under this section may be used to purchase online curriculum, train teachers, or buy course materials.
